Loss.name: Loss
Loss.text:
Creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.

Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Giant Adephage.name: Giant Adephage
Giant Adephage.text:
Trample

Whenever Giant Adephage deals combat damage to a player, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of Giant Adephage.
Giant Adephage.flavor:
"To a creature like that, we must seem like, well, bugs."

—Dars Gostok, Firefist captain

Tin Street Market.name: Tin Street Market
Tin Street Market.text:
Enchant land

Enchanted land has "{T}, Discard a card: Draw a card."
Tin Street Market.flavor:
"Sometimes I stroll along Tin Street and watch citizens busy with their daily lives. It reminds me why I do my job."

—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

Dutiful Thrull.name: Dutiful Thrull
Dutiful Thrull.flavor:
"They are useful, but there's little satisfaction in supplication that throws itself under your heel."

—Jozica, Orzhov enforcer

Maze Glider.name: Maze Glider
Maze Glider.text:
Flying

Multicolored creatures you control have flying.
Maze Glider.flavor: The pattern of the Implicit Maze extends in more than two dimensions.

Notion Thief.name: Notion Thief
Notion Thief.text:
Flash

If an opponent would draw a card except the first one he or she draws in each of his or her draw steps, instead that player skips that draw and you draw a card.

Spike Jester.name: Spike Jester
Spike Jester.flavor: For the Rakdos, "suicidal charge" and "good showmanship" are one and the same.

Scab-Clan Giant.name: Scab-Clan Giant
Scab-Clan Giant.text: When Scab-Clan Giant enters the battlefield, it fights target creature an opponent controls chosen at random.
Scab-Clan Giant.flavor: For the Gruul, bone-crushing rage is the first priority. Accuracy comes in a distant ninetieth.

Basilica Screecher.name: Basilica Screecher
Basilica Screecher.text:
Flying

Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)
Basilica Screecher.flavor: A screech in the night is all it takes for Orzhov debtors to clutch at their coin purses.

Ascended Lawmage.name: Ascended Lawmage
Ascended Lawmage.flavor: A lawmage's runic script is an act of governance given form: legislation written directly onto the air itself.

Goblin Test Pilot.name: Goblin Test Pilot
Goblin Test Pilot.text:
Flying

{T}: Goblin Test Pilot deals 2 damage to target creature or player chosen at random.
Goblin Test Pilot.flavor:
"All pilots and prototypes destroyed. Extensive collateral damage inflicted. Conclusion: flawless design."

—Manual of Melek

Mark for Death.name: Mark for Death
Mark for Death.text: Target creature an opponent controls blocks this turn if able. Untap that creature. Other creatures that player controls can't block this turn.
Mark for Death.flavor: Everyone roots for the little guy, but nobody bets on him.

Skyblinder Staff.name: Skyblinder Staff
Skyblinder Staff.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0 and can't be blocked by creatures with flying.

Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
Skyblinder Staff.flavor: "If bats are the only thing between me and a mountain of Orzhov coins, then I'm about to be a very rich thief."

Horror of the Dim.name: Horror of the Dim
Horror of the Dim.text: {U}: Horror of the Dim gains hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Horror of the Dim.flavor:
"Lesser minds can scarcely imagine such a marriage of necromancy and mind magic."

—Strava, Dimir mage

Biovisionary.name: Biovisionary
Biovisionary.text: At the beginning of the end step, if you control four or more creatures named Biovisionary, you win the game.
Biovisionary.flavor: He tired of his fellow researchers and their useless prattling, so he decided to make a network of scholars with whom he could carry a conversation.
